question: A 22-year-old obese, married nulliparous woman visits a gynecologist for irregular menstrual cycles for the past 1 year. On examination, it was found that she has hirsutism, alopecia, and acanthosis nigricans. Her ultrasound shows multiple fluid-filled sacs in the ovary. What does this indicate?

A 30-year-old male comes to the emergency department with complaints of fever for 2 days, with nocturia, intermittent stream, and pain during micturition. On palpation, the prostate feels boggy, rubbery, and tender to touch. Which of the following is the most probable cause of the condition?

A 45-year-old lady presents with heavy uterine bleeding. She reports irregular menstrual cycles for the past year. She is married but has no children and is clinically obese. An endometrial biopsy shows an increased gland to stroma ratio and the glands are cystically dilated. No nuclear atypia is seen. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 55-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding. She was previously diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia on biopsy but she never returned for a follow-up and never received the treatment. Which of the following is the most probable cause of abnormal uterine bleeding?
A 65-year-old male patient is admitted to the ward with lower urinary tract symptoms. He gets diagnosed with prostatic cancer. Which of the following is not consistent with prostatic carcinoma?

A 31-year-old female comes with a history of vaginal discharge. The discharge is green in color and is foul-smelling. On lab investigation, it is found to be due to pelvic inflammatory disease. Which of the following is related to this condition?

A mother is worried about her 17-year-old daughter who has not menstruated yet. She has well-developed secondary sexual characteristics. Ultrasound shows normal ovaries, but the uterus is absent. Which of the following is the most accurate condition describing her state?
A 25-year-old girl presents to the emergency room after noticing an abdominal mass. She has pain in her hypogastric region and her menstrual cycle is irregular. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old, para 3+0 female complains of heavy menstrual bleeding for the past year. She is taking prescribed medication but has seen no improvement. What will be the next step?
Which of the following is associated with increased estrogen levels in the body?
Which is the most common site of implantation of the fetus in an ectopic pregnancy?

A 15-year-old girl comes to the outpatient department with complaints of cyclical lower abdominal pain. On examination, she has suprapubic swelling and a bluish bulge is seen in the vestibule. What is the most probable cause?
Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is commonly caused by which bacteria?
Which of the following conditions may occur during pregnancy due to iodine deficiency in the expectant mother?
What is the most frequent cause of dysfunctional uterine bleeding?

answers.option: Diagnosis of exclusion with no known detectable cause

question: Which of the following usually causes acute bacterial prostatitis?
Which of the following conditions can cause retrograde ejaculation?
Which of the following is one of the common causes of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)?

A 47-year-old male presents to the clinic with an increased frequency of urination and dribbling urine. He often wakes up at night to urinate, 4-5 times at least and denies any history of back pain, burning micturition, and dysuria. His urinalysis shows no major changes. Based on these findings what is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is seen with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)?
Which of the following is involved in the development of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)?
Which of the following is used for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia?
Benign prostatic hyperplasia usually occurs in which zone of the prostate gland?

answers.option: It can occur in all zones of prostate

question: The levels of which of the following should be regularly monitored in benign prostatic hyperplasia?
Which of the following is seen in endometrial hyperplasia?

answers.option: The glandular to stromal ratio is decreased to more than 50%
The glandular to stromal ratio is increased to more than 50%
The stromal to glandular ratio is increased to more than 50%
The stromal to glandular ratio is increased to more than 20%
The stromal to glandular ratio is decreased to more than 20%

question: Which of the following is true about placental infection?

answers.option: It usually produces premature rupture of membranes

question: Which of the following can be used as a diagnostic criteria for polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)?
What is the incidence rate of ectopic pregnancies?
Which of the following is not given for the treatment of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)?
Pain in the lower right quadrant in a young female can be due to which of the following?

answers.option: Ectopic pregnancy in right fallopian tube
Ectopic pregnancy in left fallopian tube

question: Scarring of fallopian tube leads to which of the following?
Which impairment of the male reproductive system will not lead to sterility?
A 22-year-old medical student presents to the clinic with a history of weight gain, worsening and thickened facial hair, and irregular periods. What could she possibly be suffering from?
In which of the following, a complete absence of Mullerian ducts is seen?
In pelvic inflammatory disease (PID), what does the gonococcal infection affect?
Due to the protective effect of which of the following are women at a lower risk of cardiovascular diseases?
Which of the following is not a cause of cryptorchidism?

answers.option: Down syndrome or abnormal wall defect
Alcohol consumption by mother during pregnancy

question: In which of the following areas, the expelled contents of the rectum will not be collected in case it gets ruptured?
As a result of damage to the spongy urethra, where does the urine start to escape into?
If the left uterine tube is removed and the right one's isthmus is contracted, what can happen?

answers.option: Implantation can occur but no fertilization

question: What is anorchism?

answers.option: Absence of testes from scrotal sac

question: Which of these is not a complication of undescended testes?
A fetus is born with an enlarged clitoris and fused labia majora/minora. Ultrasound confirms that the fetus is female. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most common symptom of endometrial hyperplasia?
A deficiency of iodine in maternal blood can cause which condition in a child?
In which stage of pregnancy, are women most prone to get anemia?
Which of the following is the suitable differential diagnosis for per vaginal blood?

answers.option: An opening between bladder and vagina
Vesicovaginal fistula that occurs after delivery

question: A 19-year-old female, whose first menstrual period started 5 years ago is visiting her physician for several years. Last year she was diagnosed with oligomenorrhea and in the past month, she got hirsutism and has gained ten kilograms of weight. On ultrasound, there are no significant abdominal findings but the pelvis shows twice the size of the ovaries. What is her diagnosis?
Prostate cancer occurs in which zone of the prostate?
Which of the following is the most common cause of the puerperal pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)?

answers.option: E. coli ascending through urinary tract

question: A primigravida has a 12-week gestation, has complaints of amenorrhea, presented for her antenatal checkup. The doctor is unable to detect a fetal heartbeat. What is the diagnosis?
A doctor after a thorough examination diagnosed a patient with benign prostatic hyperplasia. He gives him 5-alpha reductase inhibitor to decrease which of the following?
Which is not a complication of pelvic inflammatory disease?

A middle-aged female patient presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of on and off pelvic pain. She denies any abnormal vaginal discharge or other associated symptoms. Ultrasonography reveals the presence of multiple ovarian cystic lesions filled with clear fluid and most of them were around 2 centimeters in diameter. Which of the following cysts originates from unruptured Graffian follicles or from follicles that ruptured and immediately sealed?

A female patient presented with multiple whitish vaginal lesions. She also reported itching in the affected area but has no other comorbidity. Her gynecologist ordered a biopsy to help identify the underlying cause which was further diagnosed as squamous cell hyperplasia. Which of the following is a characteristic feature of the disorder mentioned above?

A young female presented to the clinic with the complaint of irregular menstrual cycles. She was married for the last six years but was unable to conceive. Ultrasonography revealed multiple ovarian cysts. Which of the following is the main biochemical abnormality in this condition?

A middle-aged female presented to the clinic with complaints of irregular menstrual cycle and excessive body hair. She was unmarried and had hypertension for the last three years. Ultrasonography revealed multiple ovarian cysts. Which of the following biochemical abnormalities is associated with the polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)?
Various congenital anomalies may develop in the female genital tract during embryological development. Which of the following statements is correct regarding these anomalies?

answers.option: Gartner duct cyst arise from the mesonephric duct and is present in the wall of the uterus.
Diethylstilbestrol is associated with congenital anomalies and is still used.
Uterus didelphys refers to the single uterus with two vaginas
Vaginal adenosis refers to small residual patches of glandular epithelium in adult life
Imperforate hymen is also called vaginal atresia

question: An unmarried teenage girl undergoes a secret abortion to get rid of unwanted pregnancy. The process was carried out by using dirty knitting needles. After one week she develops abdominal pain, fever, and purulent vaginal discharge. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the condition of this patient?

answers.option: She can be treated with antipyretics and sent home
Complicated candida infection is the most common cause of this etiology
The smear made from this vaginal discharge would show Trichomonas vaginalis
Most likely diagnosis is pelvic inflammatory disease due to multiple micro-organisms
Pyosalpinx and tubo-ovarian abscesses are extremely unlikely to occur

question: Which of the following represents the karyotype of a partial mole?

A 25-year-old married woman is brought to the emergency room with complaints of severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. Her husband informs the doctor that she is 10 weeks pregnant and was scheduled to visit her doctor for an ultrasound but she could not go. Examination reveals severe pallor and acute abdomen. Ultrasound reveals the distended fallopian tubes and intraperitoneal hemorrhage. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following abnormalities is common between epispadias and hypospadias?

A 35-year-old woman Para 2+0 presented in the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding. Bleeding above which of the following volumes will be categorized as heavy menstrual bleeding?

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?
A pediatrician notices a 4-year-old girl having stained underwear and grape-like masses coming out of the vestibule. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 58-year-old post-menopausal woman presents with heavy bleeding and an adnexal mass. Histopathology reveals an increased gland-to-stroma ratio and the masses are well-circumscribed necrotic and show nuclear atypia. Which of the following is true for her condition?

answers.option: Pregnancy related bleeding should be ruled out
This condition arises due to an untreated protozoal infection
It is due excessive oxytocin released by posterior pituitary
Mutations in PTEN tumor suppressor genes are common
It is due to unopposed high progesterone levels

question: A 16-year-old girl is brought to the hospital with the complaint of delayed menarche. On examination, she has a webbed neck, a broad chest, and widely spaced inverted nipples. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 17-year-old girl presented to the clinic with complaints of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and a physical exam shows normal secondary sexual characteristics but a short vagina. The uterus is undetected and two inguinal masses are found instead. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 15-year-old girl experiencing pelvic pain was examined and a mass was found in her ovaries. The mass on excision was white with necrotic patches and had primitive mesenchymal cells of cartilage, muscle tissue, and foci of neuroepithelial differentiation. What is the most likely cause?
A post-menopausal woman having endometrial hyperplasia with increased gland-to-stroma ratio with atypia presented to the outpatient department. What advice would you give her?

answers.option: Ask her to come for checkup every five years
Reassure her that there is nothing to worry about
Advise her to go for hysterectomy due to risk of carcinoma

question: A 28-year-old married female visits the obstetrics outpatient department with a history of a missed period and complains of dark brown bleeding from the vagina along with severe nausea and vomiting. She also complains of the passing of grapelike cysts from the vagina. Her ultrasound finding shows the presence of many small cysts in the uterine cavity. Excessively high levels of which hormone helps in the diagnosis of this condition?

A 14-year-old girl began menstruation 1 year ago. She now has irregular menstrual cycles with oligomenorrhea and amenorrhea. On examination, she has acne and increase hair growth on her face. She has an elevated ratio of LH to FSH. Which of the following is most likely to produce these findings?

A 27-year-old lady undergoes uterine curettage after a spontaneous abortion. Microscopy shows intimately admixed cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast. Abundant hemorrhage and necrosis are present. No chorionic villi are seen. Radio-imaging shows nodules in both lungs as well as the brain. Which of the following statements regarding this patient's diagnosis is true?

answers.option: More than half of these tumors arise in ectopic pregnancies
Alpha-fetoprotein levels are used to monitor this disease
In males this tumor is classified as a sex-cord stromal tumor
Ovarian variant of this tumor has a very good prognosis
Response to evacuation and chemotherapy is usually excellent

question: A male child is brought to the pediatrician's clinic for abdominal pain. He also has vomiting and diarrhea. A detailed stool report shows infective diarrhea which responds well to antibiotics. However, his ultrasonography reveals an abnormal location of male genital organs. He is advised to consult a surgeon for early intervention to avoid future complications. Orchiopexy is a surgical procedure for the correction of which of the following abnormalities?
What is the most common cause of abnormal uterine bleeding in adolescents?
Which of the following correctly identifies the reason why prostatic hyperplasia predominantly affects muscle fibers?

answers.option: Dihydrotestosterone (DHT) is located only in the stromal cells
5 alpha-reductase is located only in stromal cells

question: A 30-year-old male developed epididymitis. On culture, gram-negative diplococci, Neisseria gonorrhea, was located. Which one of the following laboratory culture media will be the most appropriate to grow this particular organism?

Each year, there are an estimated 6 million new cases of syphilis globally in people aged 15-49 years. Which of the following best corresponds to the most common signs and symptoms of early or ''primary syphilis'' infection?

answers.option: Painless chancre, sores on the genitals and/or mouth
Painful chancre, sores on the face
High grade fever with body aches

question: A 28-year-old sexually active woman comes to the clinic with a complaint of yellowish-greenish, foul-smelling vaginal discharge. She experiences pain during sexual intercourse and has red spots on her vaginal walls. She also mentions having discomfort and a burning sensation while urinating. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Based on the data gathered by the World Health Organization (WHO), which sexually transmitted virus is recognized as a significant cause of cervical cancer, infecting thousands of individuals annually?
Which of the following is related to the term ''chocolate cyst''?

A 33-year-old male develops urethritis having a characteristic fishy smell. On culture, the pathogen isolated is found to be Ureaplasma urealyticum. The characteristic fishy smell on this condition is due to the production of which of the following substances?

A 35-year-old female with 32 weeks of gestational amenorrhea presents to the gynecology ward. Her ultrasound findings are placenta in the lower uterine segment covering the cervical os completely. What is the diagnosis?

A 28-year-old man presents to the clinic with small, painless nodules in the genital region that have burst open creating beefy, red ulcers. The physician suspects it to be a case of Donovanosis. Which one of the following staining techniques will be used to diagnose the condition?

A 32-year-old male presents to the reproductive endocrinology clinic with a complaint of not having children since he got married. The patient reports a lack of facial and body hair development, reduced muscle mass, and diminished libido. Upon further investigation, his plasma testosterone levels are found to be significantly low with low levels of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism due to a genetic mutation

question: The secretory phase of the endometrium has which characteristic?

answers.option: There are no glands in the endometrium

question: A woman is diagnosed with squamous cell carcinoma. Which of the following is a characteristic feature of this disease?
A boy presents with an empty scrotum and inguinal swelling. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Causes of sexual dysfunction may include:
Bladder diverticulum is most commonly associated with:

A female presents with itching in the pubic region and white patches on the vaginal wall. She is diagnosed with squamous cell hyperplasia. Which of the following is a characteristic feature of this disease?
Which of the following is an antagonist of progesterone?
In thalassemia which chromosome has the gene that codes for the beta chain of hemoglobin?
Which trisomy is associated with Down syndrome?
A 68-year-old man with raised PSA levels is diagnosed with adenocarcinoma of the prostate gland. Which of the following is a likely contributing factor?
Which species causes pseudohyphae in the vagina?
A small tender mass on the testes could indicate:
A young girl with normal breast development but a small vagina and no uterus has a palpable mass in the inguinal canal. Which hormone levels should be assessed?
The external urethral meatus in males is derived from which of the following:
BPH can progress to which of the following conditions?
Which hormone helps control bleeding due to an anovulatory cycle?
What is placenta previa?

answers.option: Adherence of the placental villous tissue directly to the myometrium
Partial or complete absence of the decidua
Placenta implants in the lower uterine segment or cervix
Placenta invades and perforates uterine wall

question: Which zone of the prostate is commonly involved in benign prostatic hyperplasia?
In pre-eclampsia which arteries show physiologic alterations?
Which one of the following is a non-neoplastic physiologic ovarian cyst?
When one paramesonephric duct is retarded in its growth and does not fuse with the other one, this anomaly is known as:
What is the underlying cause of endometrial hyperplasia?
Which endometrial condition is more likely to progress to endometrial carcinoma?
Which of the following is not a consequence of hypospadias and epispadias?

answers.option: Increased risk of ascending urinary infections

question: In which of the following congenital anomaly of Penis the orifice of the prepuce is too small to permit its normal retraction?

In which of the following congenital anomalies there is complete or partial failure of intra-abdominal testes to descend into the scrotal sac and is associated with testicular dysfunction and increased risk of testicular cancer?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
Which of the following is an acute complication of pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)?

Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection that begins in the vulva or vagina and spreads upward to involve most of the structures in the female genital system. Which of the following is a symptom of PID?

Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection that begins in the vulva or vagina and spreads upward to involve most of the structures in the female genital system. Which of the following microorganisms is the cause of PID?
